history.text: This seems to be a well-liked movie
yes the ratings are high on this movie
The critics seem to think it was well done for a historical drama.
it seems the movie is scened in the older history period but they say that speilberg made it easy to follow so that was probably nice
movie takes place in 1970s
It looks like one critic thought it was too easy to follow... like there should have been more suspense maybe?
maybe so but they are saying history repeats or goes in circles and its them trying to break thatg cycle
True.
they have meryl streep playing as the first female publisher of a major newspaper
That is really impressive. I would imagine it was difficult for Katharine Graham to become respected in her position back then.
it says thatg the movie is more interactive with its viewers because your not just getting a story explained to you

Hmmm... I thought it said the opposite. Maybe I read it wrong. I think it's pretty wild that McNamara told Ellsberg and Macomber that the Vietnam war effort was hopeless, then came home and told the press he had full confidence in the war effort!
yeah and then he copies the classified reports
Yeah, Ellsberg copied the reports and leaked them to the New York Times.
he was working both sides i think or at least thats what im getting from the tex
I wonder what happened next?
looks like he got tracked down by ben bagikian
Graham had a very difficult decision to make about whether or not to publish.
yes by her publishing the story she could face a legal situation

I wonder if it c
ould have been considered treason to share that information?
yeah whats crazy it that they have the same souce thats telling them both the information
It sounds like the lawyers tried to talk Kathryn out of publishing the stories, but she published them anyhow. That was pretty gutsy!
yeah it was and then the post and times go to court together to argue their right to publish
Then a bunch of other newspapers ran the stories too. I guess they figured Nixon couldn't sue them all! LOL
(I mean prosecute)
lol right but the court rules in the times and post favor and they end up winning
It's crazy that Nixon banned the Post from the White House. So much for freedom of the press LOL.
exactly he was afraid they would publish any other secrets lol but this story led them straight into the watergate scandalbecause a security guard discovers the break in
Yeah that's pretty awesome. Maybe they should do a sequel about Watergate.
I wonder what happened to Kathryn Graham after all this?
i like that other newpaper places came together and posted the story it wouldnt have been fair if the court ruled in favor of the white house
Yeah, I like that too. It's cool that they all stuck together.
i wonder what happened after th guard saw the break in
Right. Seriously, maybe they'll do a sequel? That would be cool.
So do we need to click "Finish Conversation" or does it end automatically?
im not sure actually

uid1response.feedback: i like this type of suvey
